result.execSummary:
The defendant Leslie A. Marquard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.  If defendant is revoked from probation she has 1 day jail credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1 and Ct 2 in this case

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
